data.title: VideoPlayer taking a M.X.F.Game instance as arg?
data.body:
I am working on "porting" an XNA 4.0 game over to Mac OS X and Linux and am using MonoGame to accomplish this task.

Thus far MOSTLY everything is in there.. I found a few methods/properties missing here and there which I will send a pull-request for when done.

But the main issue right now I am having is the fact that the VideoPlayer implementation differs from the MS Documentation..  the Documentation states that the constructor takes no arguments, yet MonoGame's takes a single arg of a Game instance.

It looks like the primary reason it does this is ONLY to acquire access to the GraphicsDevice and Window objects.. So, my question is, how can this be refactored to NOT require passing the Game instance to the VideoPlayer constructor??

data.title: Multiple fixes for Mac full screen toggle and cursor state
data.body: Also includes a fix for TargetElapsedTime that was not implemented

data.title: FlatRedBall Changes
data.body:
Implementations for DrawUserPrimitives and DrawIndexedUserPrimitives (though this one is not tested).  

Updates to BasicEffect and Texture2D to apply states before rendering.  

A couple of properties changed to be syntactically correct.  They were just auto implemented from an interface.

Added VertexPositionColorTexture to Android project.

Properly implemented Blending.

Fix for GLStateManager.

data.body:
Fix for full screen toggling
Fix for weird cursor behavior on fullscreen and windowed switching
Fix for Matrix.CreateLookAt fixing "W' matrix
Fixes for keyup and keydown not being recognized

data.title: README.md fix
Several tweaks ( I hope it doesn't break anything )
Fix Non-Power of 2 Texture Scaling on Android
data.body:
Fix non-power of 2 textures getting content texture scaled when creating a power
of two texture. This should prevent aliasing/improper aspect ratios for source
content.

data.title: More tweaks for Video Player on iOS and Android
Fix to allow the OnStop event to fire correctly, which therefore hides the QTMovieView.
data.body: Fix to allow the OnStop event to fire correctly, which therefore hides the QTMovieView.

data.title: kjpou1 : Moved Frame setting to VideoPlayer class, where it is easier to get to the Backbuffer Width and Height.
data.body: kjpou1 please look over this VideoPlayer pull request and over the previous one that was accidentally pulled in by dean1972.

data.title: Add Quaternion Transform for Vector2
data.body: There was a missing method in Vector2 that has the signature Transform(Vector2 position, Quaternion quat).

data.title: Initial VideoPlayer implementation
data.body: Changes to get VideoPlayer implemented. Audio works, but video does not. Seems the View is not being shown.

data.title: Android Render Target work around
data.body: HACK!! A fix to get render targets to work under Android. for some reason we need to call GL.ReadPixels to get the texture to work. We need to remove this. Also for some reason the wood.xnb file does not load correctly under android.

data.title: Refactored SamplerState fix for SpriteBatch
data.body:
This should be much nicer.
- Moved the wrapping mode translation into GraphicsExtensions.
- Added more generic ApplyTo extension for SpriteBatch in GraphicsExtensions (arch/API specific stuff kept out of SamplerState itself).
- Bonus fix in SpriteBatcher.cs, you were using a bad texenv value:
-      GL.TexEnv (TextureEnvTarget.TextureEnv, TextureEnvParameter.TextureEnvMode, (int)All.BlendSrc);
  167 
-      GL.TexEnv (TextureEnvTarget.TextureEnv, TextureEnvParameter.TextureEnvMode, (int)All.Blend);

Please review the changes, I'm not sure what happened with Lidgren Network in the csproj. :( I'm really not friends with git yet.

data.title: Merged Andre Steve's Audio cache request
Ensure SamplerState change works on Android and Mac OS.
Ported cadahl's Sampler State fix.
Fix for Colors being inverted under windows
data.body:
Added internal ImageEx extension to support converting RGB System.Drawing.Image to BGR.

When loading Images from a non .xnb source (e.g png, jpeg) the colours are all wrong. This patch swaps over the colors . It might need to be applied to other platforms as well. The ImageEx.cs is a generic extension class and should be available to all platforms

data.title: Android ContentManager improvements
data.body:
ContentManager.cs:
- Implemented OpenStream and ReadAsset.
- Implemented cache of previously loaded assets.
- Implemented proper Dispose methods.
  Game.cs:
- Implemented proper Dispose methods.
- Disposes ContentManager.

data.title: Multithreaded iOS audio and Rectangle.Intersect fixes
data.body:
- Added multithreading to audio for iOS
  - Fixed a Rectangle.Intersect not returning correct values.

data.title: Android Game class now has same ctor as other platforms
data.body:
Modified Android's Game class to function more like XNA's Game class in that Game.Initialize calls Initialize on all GameComponents and then calls Game.LoadContent.  Game.Update and Game.Draw no longer check for "initialized".

The default ContentManager is created in the Game constructor instead of on first access.

Added a public static property called Activity (gets and sets _contextInstance).  This is Android-specific and avoids having to pass the Activity as a parameter to the Game constructor.  This means that we remove all of the #if ANDROID ... #else ... #endif in all projects around the constructors of their Game classes.  The Game.Activity static property is set in the Activity.OnCreate method before constructing the game instance.

data.title: Texture2D Dipose() fixes
data.body:
Fixed RenderTarget2D Dipose().
Added conditional Dipose() for Texture2D if texture is null (such as RenderTarget2D)

data.title: Changes to ensure Dispose is called and therefore GL.DeleteTextures too
Four finger multitask gesture fixes/Deactivated fixes
data.body:
Fixed touchpanel issues with multitouch gestures which caused the view to lose active state.
This also fixes touch issues for things like phone calls.

data.title: Fix to allow ContentManager to load *.xnb file correctly on Linux.
